articles.title: The crypto clock is ticking
articles.author: Muhammad Ahmed Mustafa Qayyum
articles.summary: Pakistan's central bank banned financial institutions from dealing in cryptocurrencies in 2018, but despite the ban, crypto adoption grew. Pakistan Crypto Council was formed, spearheaded by investor Bilal bin Saqib, who called for regulatory clarity and pro-business laws. Senator Afnan Ullah Khan introduced the Virtual Assets Bill 2025, proposing legal recognition for digital assets, a Digital Rupee backed by the Pakistani currency and creating Virtual Asset Zones for blockchain innovation under regulatory supervision.
